column4: hi, can anybody please tell me how to change the values of energy star? (xset +dpms) Here is something that I want to increase Standby: 33    Suspend: 49    Off: 66
xset dpms X Y Z   (in seconds)
hmm.. that was simple, so stupid of me :( thanks a lot
are you rebooting?
nope
so just after a few minutes, the output of "xset q" changes?
yeah
what environment do you run in?  Default ubuntu with unity?
I use KDE on Ubuntuv12.04
is it possible that I it is because I have two desktop environment?

hmm.  I don't know.  I guess there's some kde daemon.  I think kde uses dconf, check dconf-editor for something relevant.  Also, aren't those settings exposed in the gui somewhere?  Maybe easier to just modify there
did you load both of them?
what do mean by both of them? I can start only one at a time right?
you could start another instance of X and load both.  But, I was actually asking if you had logged into both (log into one, log out, log into the other)
nope, actually I haven't logged into unity for months
maybe someone in #kubuntu knows.  But my strategy would be to check running daemons for anything obvious, check dconf, see if it happens when you load a different environment
well I have hell lot of daemons running, but none of them is dconf.
nah, I just mean to look for daemons that look like they have to do with power settings.  Dconf was unrelated
ohh...
and these settings may actually be exposed through the gui; but I haven't used kde in a long time

if you're looking for random suggestions (since you've been at this for a while now): have you tried logging into different (preferably simpler, like fluxbox for example) environments?  Does it get reset at boot, or only after login?
it gets reset at its will :( some times in a min, some times in 10 or 15. (at least I am not able to find a pattern). It has no connection is restarting/rebooting
